column4: new gutsy install / encrypted on a raid-five / 'error loading os'
godmami - what's s/he doing that you're not?
oh, well there's your problem goodmami - tell them to install the 4965
I'm not sure why his computer loaded the ipw driver, since we did practically the same install
it is installed... he's using the 2.6.22-14 kernel.  he can find it with locate
how can he enable it?  I told him to try modprobe -r ipw3945 and modprobe iwl4965
does the regular wireless ui allow you to choose a driver?  (going to check)
- i was thinking something like the restricted drivers manager
we both have a Lenovo Thinkpad x61t.  I have more ram and the Intel Turbo Memory
actually, he might have the wlan card... lemme ask
- it may be possible that he actually has *that* wireless card, and that is *actually* sucks
would it be possible that he could disable that WLAN card (if he has it) and use the built-in card?
the WLAN card was an add-on option
- wait, you think there are two wireless cards in the machine?
- what does he get on an iwconfig?
excuse me.. i might have meant WWAN
- that makes more sense, but should not interfere
http://pastebin.osuosl.org/5054
- well, that supports the assertion that there is only one wlan card, whether or not there is a wwan card
so is it possible to get his machine to use the iwl driver instead of the ipw driver?
- i don't know
heh... ok
yeah well no luck on the iwl4965 front.  thanks for all your help though
